quotes.quote: Graves aren't for the dead. They're for the loved ones the dead leave behind them. Once those loved ones have gone, once all the lives that have touched the occupant of any given grave had ended, then the grave's purpose was fulfilled and ended.
Never the grave gives back what it has won!
The grave Is but the threshold of eternity.
All roads end at the grave, which is the gate to nothingness.
Everybody dies, but some spend a whole life digging their grave.
There will be sleeping enough in the grave.
Some people die and you realize that the only mark they left on earth are the tomb stones under which they lie.
A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
Grave was the man in years, in looks, in word, his locks were grey, yet was his courage green.
Every man is grave alone.
Even in the grave, all is not lost.
Grave is a journey not a destination.
Don't go to the grave with life unused.
The paths of glory lead but to the grave.
The grave will fall in upon him who digs it.
There is plenty of time to sleep in the grave.
The graveyard is the everlasting home of every man.
Only where there are graves are there resurrections.
If you live in a graveyard, you can't weep for everyone.
Most people go to their grave with their music inside them.
No one can escape the grave.
To say what you feel is to dig your own grave.
The grave has a door on its inner side.
A grave is such a quiet place.
Build castles, don't dig graves.
Only on the edge of the grave can man conclude anything.
The last excessive feelings of delight are always grave.
